## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
```{r}
install.packages("tidyverse")
```

```{r}
library("tidyverse")
```
```{r}
data(mpg)
```


```{r}
mpg %>% 
  add_row(manufacturer= "jeep",
          displ=2,
          year=2008,
          cyl=4,
          trans="manual(m6)",
          cty=15,
          hwy=24,
          fl="p",
          class="suv")
```


```{r}
mpg %>% 
  mutate(
    cty=cty*1.609/3.785,
    hwy=hwy*1.609/3.785,
    manufacturer=as_factor(manufacturer),
    model=as_factor(model),
  )
```
```{r}
mpg_editada <-mpg %>%
  mutate_if(
    .predicate= is.character,
    .funs= as_factor
  )
mpg_editada
  
```
```{r}
mpg_editada2 <- mpg %>% 
  mutate_if(
    .predicate= is.character,
    .funs= as_factor
  ) %>% 
  mutate(trans=fct_lump_min(trans, 20,
                            other_level="Otros"))
mpg_editada2
```

```{r}
mpg_editada2 %>% 
  ggplot()+
  geom_point(mapping=aes(x=displ, y=hwy))
```
```{r}
mpg_editada2 %>% 
  ggplot() +
  geom_point(mapping= aes(x=displ,
                          y= hwy,
                          color= class)
             )
```
```{r}
ggplot(data= mpg_editada2) +
  geom_point(mapping= aes( x= displ,
                           y= hwy,
                           color= class,
                           shape= drv,
                           size= cyl),
             alpha= 0.7)
```
```{r}
mpg_editada2 %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x= manufacturer, y = displ))+
  geom_boxplot()
```
```{r}
data( world_bank_pop, package= "tidyr")
pop <- world_bank_pop
head(pop)
```
```{r}
pop_tidy <- pop %>% 
  #i)
  pivot_longer(cols= -c(country,indicador),
               names_to= "year",values_to = "value") %>% 
  #ii)
  pivot_wider(names_from = indicator,
              values_from = value) %>% 
  #iii)
  select(country, year, contains ("TOTL")) %>% 
  #iv)
  rename(urban_pop = SP:URB:TOTL,total_pop = SP.POP.TOTL) %>% 
  #v)
  mutate( rural_pop_pct = (1- urban_pop / total_pop)*100,
          country = as_factor(country),
          year = as.integer(year)
          ) %>% 
  #vi)
  filter(country %in% c("MEX","BRA","ARG")) %>% 
  #vii)
  as_tsibble(key= country, index = year)

pop_tidy
```
```{r}
install.packages("tsibble")
```
